comments.body: We should add a disclaimer here that this does not validate that the user is actually authorized to act as those parties and that in a real setup, there needs to be a mapping from users to the list of allowed claims somewhere.

:+1: I've moved https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/pull/8622/files/cd09bad242cd796fb0be12939ead38385c190760#diff-e9c85b993f267409dd5b9c6a5db5d817e4037e61f15e1efbc9fc1040a0b82f39R111-R112 up and expanded it a bit.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +53,57 @@*************

`Create a new rule <auth0-create-rule_>`_.
This will define user privileges, the mapping from scopes to ledger claims, and construct the access token.

comments.body: Once we have the disclaimer, Iâ€™d refer back to it here and say that because the rule accepts all claims, we can get claims for Alice.
